data.question: What is the chemical formula of the compound that adopts a structure analogous to a traditional perovskite?
At what temperature does [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 undergo an order−disorder phase transition?
Is the phase transition in [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 driven by ordering of hydrogen atoms?
What method was used to synthesize [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3?
data.answer: Reaction between zinc chloride and water in dimethylformamide (DMF) heated overnight in a Teflon lined autoclave at 125 °C.

data.question: Does the dielectric constant of [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 show an anomaly around 160 K?
What type of transition does [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 exhibit according to the specific heat measurements?
Is the electrical ordering in [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 associated with an order−disorder phase transition unprecedented in hybrid frameworks?
What is the role of dimethylformamide in the synthesis of [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3?
data.answer: In situ hydrolysis of DMF produces formic acid and dimethyl ammonium cation, which are the building blocks for the compound.

data.question: Does the structure of [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 at room temperature resemble that of an ABX3 perovskite?
What is the significance of the dielectric constant anomaly observed around 160 K for [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3?
data.answer: It furnishes clear evidence that the compound becomes antiferroelectric below 160 K on cooling.

data.question: What does the clear anomaly in the specific heat of [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 around 156 K indicate?
Is the transition in [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 much more complex than a simple 3-fold order−disorder model?
What is the value of ΔS for the phase transition of [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3?
What future studies are planned to further understand the transition mechanism of [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3?
data.answer: Neutron diffraction studies on a deuterated sample and NMR studies

data.question: Is the electrical ordering in [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 a result of guest molecules in pores?
What does the reproducibility of the synthesis of [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 as a pure single phase compound indicate?
data.answer: The synthesis conditions have been optimized.

data.question: What is the role of cooling in the synthesis of [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3?
data.answer: Slow cooling to room temperature results in the formation of branched structures consisting of needle-shaped crystals.

data.question: Does the crystal structure of [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 change upon cooling below 156 K?
What does the presence of weak satellites in the synchrotron X-ray powder data at 100 K for [(CH3)2NH2]Zn(HCOO)3 indicate?
data.answer: The formation of a superlattice due to ordering of the NH2 hydrogen atoms.
